abstract_summ: Conclusions: Depopulation, single celling, and asymptomatic testing within jails can be effective strategies to mitigate COVID-19 transmission in addition to standard public health measures.National level data will hide an increasing heterogeneity of COVID-19 infections and mobility, and new ways of real-time data presentation to the public are required.Travel and physical distancing interventions have been implemented across the World to mitigate the COVID-19 pandemic, but studies are needed to quantify the effectiveness of these measures across regions and time.Aim: We aim to determine the time frame between a change in COVID-19 measures at the population level and the observable impact of such a change on cases.Many jurisdictions with declines in reported COVID-19 cases are moving to relax measures, while others are continuing to intensify efforts to reduce transmission.
title_summ: The projected impact of mitigation and suppression strategies on the COVID-19 epidemic in Senegal: A modelling studyLong time frames to detect the impact of changing COVID-19 control measuresThe effectiveness of interventions to reduce COVID-19 transmission in a large urban jailAssessing the effect of global travel and contact reductions to mitigate the COVID-19 pandemic and resurgenceGo local: The key to controlling the COVID-19 pandemic in the post lockdown eraModeling the effects of intervention strategies on COVID-19 transmission dynamics.
title_abstract_phrases: The projected impact of mitigation and suppression strategies on the COVID-19 epidemic in Senegal: A modelling studyBackground: Physical distancing measures that reduce social contacts have formed a key part of national COVID-19 containment and mitigation strategies.Conclusions: Depopulation, single celling, and asymptomatic testing within jails can be effective strategies to mitigate COVID-19 transmission in addition to standard public health measures.National level data will hide an increasing heterogeneity of COVID-19 infections and mobility, and new ways of real-time data presentation to the public are required.Aim: We aim to determine the time frame between a change in COVID-19 measures at the population level and the observable impact of such a change on cases.Many jurisdictions with declines in reported COVID-19 cases are moving to relax measures, while others are continuing to intensify efforts to reduce transmission.
